Key Match Events: Jack Grealish gave England an early lead as he curled a low finish into the bottom corner after a lovely flicked pass from Angel Gomes.
Trent Alexander-Arnold scored a brilliant free-kick into the top corner from 25 yards out, giving England the cushion that felt necessary.
Declan Rice added to the lead with a well-finished goal as he burst into the six-yard box to get on the end of Ollie Watkinsâ€™ low ball into the middle.
Arttu Hoskonen scored a consolation goal for Finland in the closing stages, taking full advantage of a defensive lapse from a corner.
Post-Match Reflections: England are worthy winners but the hosts have created openings and if Fredrik Jensen had brought his shooting boots, this may have been a more uncomfortable evening for Lee Carsley and his side.
That was a frustrating goal for England to concede but no less than Finland deserve on the balance of play, writes Dan Kilpatrick.
